text: Edgware Road is a London Underground station. It is on the Circle, District and Hammersmith & City lines. The station is by the edge of Chapel Street and Cabbell Street. There have been suggestions in the past to make a new name for one of the Edgware Road stations to stop there being confusion. ==History== This station was part of the world's first below ground railway when it was started as part of the Metropolitan Railway between and . It was opened on 10 January 1863. The station was where one of the bombings in 7 July 2005 London bombings happened. Mohammad Sidique Khan exploded a bomb at about 8:50am, on a train that was leaving the station. 6 people died in the bombing. ==References== Category:Circle line stations Category:District line stations Category:Hammersmith & City line stations Category:Tube stations in the City of Westminster Category:1863 establishments in England Category:Railway stations opened in 1863
title: Edgware Road tube station (Circle, District and Hammersmith & City lines)
